metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13694 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The acpi_ps_complete_final_op() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/psobject.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.9 does not flush the node and node_ext caches and causes a kernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information from kernel memory and bypass the KASLR protection mechanism (in the kernel through 4.9) via a crafted ACPI table.

notes.Note: tyhicks> As of 17.04, KASLR is not yet enabled by default in Ubuntu See the patchwork.k.o reference for a possible fix. As of 2017-08-25, it has not yet been merged upstream. sbeattie> drivers/acpi/acpica/psobject.c::acpi_ps_complete_final_op()
